messages.subject: Re: Bad information
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you for that information. I am very sorry- I had enjoyed this series immensely and it inspired me to learn about the Shinsengumi. Perhaps the author can
messages.messageBody:
Thank you for that information. I am very sorry- I had enjoyed this
series immensely and it inspired me to learn about the Shinsengumi.
Perhaps the author can find a new publisher and finish her story.



--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "momomanjyuu2004" <momomanjyuu2004@y...>
wrote:
>

> I am lamenting it very much.
> The series of PMK manga was stopped with Vol.5.
> The author was hardly able to advance a story in a slump for one
> year.
> And it declared the stop of publishing formally by Vol.5.
> The story is the halfway portion of "Aburanokoji no hen".
> It is very unfinished.
> It is not known whether it is serialized again.
> However, I think that production of the second season of PMK anime
> became impossible.
>
> Shinsengumi manga which I expect is only "Getsumeiseiki".(cry)
>
>
> By the way, has "SHOJO BEAT" MAGAZINE already become the center of
> attention here?
> It is the Shojo manga magazine which BIZ will publish in July, this
> year.
> The series of Kaze Hikaru is determined by the magazine.
>
> http://www.viz.com/news/newsroom/2005/02_shojobeat.php
>
> momoiro-usagi

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Bad information
messages.msgSnippet: PMK was stopped?  Thats a new to me.   I don t know how popular it is in the U.S. but I certainly enjoy it very much.   Thats a real shame that they cut short
messages.messageBody:
PMK was stopped? Thats a new to me. I don't know how popular it is in the U.S. but I certainly enjoy it very much. Thats a real shame that they cut short a series just because your not intrested in the history and conflict behind it. Thanks for sharing this kind of info. with us, Momo-san.


---------------------------------

messages.subject: Re: Bad information
messages.msgSnippet: ... to share it with a few PMK communities (if it already hasn t been put there.) I m sorry, I do not understand this text. However, I cannot release the manga
messages.messageBody:
> Momo: If you have a link to a story, would you post it? I'd like
to share it with a few PMK communities (if it already hasn't been
put there.)

I'm sorry, I do not understand this text. However, I cannot release
the manga in a network. I do not have skill and I am a Japanese. The
act is a crime certainly by a law of Japan^^;;;
It is possible if it is that I explain a story.


> Well, there is Burai - but that too is still plodding along. Mmm.
Perhaps we should all harass Watsuki-sensei to pick up his
Shinsengumi manga idea after all.

Burai was stopped by command of the chief editor of a magazine. The
magazine which Burai serialized took the plan which eliminates
History manga. Since it was a Shinsengumi boom last year, Burai
announced some short stories with the magazine different from it.
Burai is the good work with which the story is built well.
Therefore, judgment of this chief editor is very regrettable.

Shinsengumi mangas are unpopular and there are many works which are
stopped. Ordinary manga readers are not interested in Bakumatsu. And
they sense the complicated social situation of Bakumatsu
troublesome, and do not read those mangas.

PMK was very popular rare Shinsengumi manga. I think that about
400,000 people are disappointed in Japan because this work was
stopped.

I also want to see Shinsengumi manga which Watsuki-sensei draws^_^



> I did mention this, but there isn't much to discuss at the
moment. The bad news about Viz is their turnaround time from serial
publication into graphic novel format. Regardless, I remain
hopeful that Viz will stick with its commitment to KnH, unlike the
other manga companies which have dropped titles after publishing one
volume of a series. In the U.S., it is one of the most stable and
long-existing publication companies around.

Since I did not come to SHQ recently, I have not noticed^^;;;

momoiro-usagi

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Bad information
messages.msgSnippet: Momo: If you have a link to a story, would you post it? I d like to share it with a few PMK communities (if it already hasn t been put there.) ... Well, there
messages.messageBody:
Momo: If you have a link to a story, would you post it? I'd like to share it with a few PMK communities (if it already hasn't been put there.)

>Shinsengumi manga which I expect is only "Getsumeiseiki".(cry)

Well, there is Burai - but that too is still plodding along. Mmm. Perhaps we should all harass Watsuki-sensei to pick up his Shinsengumi manga idea after all.


>By the way, has "SHOJO BEAT" MAGAZINE already become the center of
>attention here?
>It is the Shojo manga magazine which BIZ will publish in July, this
>year.
>The series of Kaze Hikaru is determined by the magazine.
>
><http://www.viz.com/news/newsroom/2005/02_shojobeat.php>http://www.viz.com/news/newsroom/2005/02_shojobeat.php

I did mention this, but there isn't much to discuss at the moment. The bad news about Viz is their turnaround time from serial publication into graphic novel format. Regardless, I remain hopeful that Viz will stick with its commitment to KnH, unlike the other manga companies which have dropped titles after publishing one volume of a series. In the U.S., it is one of the most stable and long-existing publication companies around.

S




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Bad information
messages.msgSnippet: I am lamenting it very much. The series of PMK manga was stopped with Vol.5. The author was hardly able to advance a story in a slump for one year. And it
messages.messageBody:
I am lamenting it very much.
The series of PMK manga was stopped with Vol.5.
The author was hardly able to advance a story in a slump for one
year.
And it declared the stop of publishing formally by Vol.5.
The story is the halfway portion of "Aburanokoji no hen".
It is very unfinished.
It is not known whether it is serialized again.
However, I think that production of the second season of PMK anime
became impossible.

Shinsengumi manga which I expect is only "Getsumeiseiki".(cry)


By the way, has "SHOJO BEAT" MAGAZINE already become the center of
attention here?
It is the Shojo manga magazine which BIZ will publish in July, this
year.
The series of Kaze Hikaru is determined by the magazine.

http://www.viz.com/news/newsroom/2005/02_shojobeat.php

momoiro-usagi
